interestingFact: Japan has more than 5 million vending machines.
The Amazon Rainforest in Brazil produces 20% of the world's oxygen.
Iceland has no army, navy, or air force.
Australia is home to more kangaroos than humans.
India is the world's largest democracy.
Egyptian pyramids were constructed over 4,500 years ago.
Finland has more saunas than cars.
Canada has the longest coastline in the world.
Chile is home to the driest desert on Earth, the Atacama Desert.
Norway introduced salmon sushi to Japan.
Russia spans 11 time zones across two continents.
China is the only country to have a giant panda as a national animal.
Madagascar is home to 70% of the world's lemur species.
South Africa has three capital cities: Pretoria, Bloemfontein, and Cape Town.
Mexico City is sinking about 10 inches every year due to the soft ground it's built on.
Switzerland has 7,000 lakes, covering 6% of its surface area.
Greece has more archaeological museums than any other country.
New Zealand was the first country to grant women the right to vote in 1893.
The oldest known human settlement, Göbekli Tepe, is in Turkey and dates back over 11,000 years.
Italy has the most UNESCO World Heritage Sites of any country, with over 50.
